intro: Cyrtandra schizostyla, commonly known as the Hawaiian flame flower, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. Its flowers are pollinated primarily by birds, particularly the honeycreeper, due to their nectar-rich structure. Cyrtandra schizostyla is also notable for its role in traditional Hawaiian culture and its ecological importance in forest ecosystems.
